isis.stitle: 7.3 Liter Diesel Engine Service (1991) - LUBRICATING OIL PUMP, OIL FILTER AND COOLER - GENERAL OPERATION - OIL PUMP (REMOVAL AND REASSEMBLY)

step1.para: Remove the oil drain plug and gasket to drain engine oil from the system.
Loosen and remove the oil pan mounting bolts and washers which secure the oil pan.

Insert two pry bars through the crankcase dowel-holes on the left side of the crankcase pan rail. Pry the oil pan off. This prevents pan rail damage and distortion. Refer to Figure 8.6
.

note.para: The oil pan is GASKETLESS R.T.V. sealant (Part No. 446 839 C1) is used to seal the oil pan to the crankcase.

step1.para:
Loosen and remove the two oil pickup tube retaining bolts. Note the location of the long and short bolt for reassembly. Refer to Figure 8.7
.

Prior to oil pump removal, check and record oil pump drive gear to crankshaft gear backlash as follows: (Refer to Figure 8.8.
)

step2.para: Mount a magnetic base dial indicator on the front of the crankcase with the tip of the dial indicator tip on a gear tooth of the oil pump drive gear.
Move the oil pump gear, by hand, to the right and left.
Record each reading (right and left). If backlash exceeds the SPECIFICATIONS, replace the oil pump assembly.

step1.para: Check oil pump drive gear end play, prior to oil pump removal as follows:

step2.para: Mount a magnetic base dial indicator on the front of the crankcase with the tip of the dial indicator on the oil pump gear face.
Gently push the oil pump gear towards the rear of the engine and "ZERO" the indicator.
Insert a pry bar behind the gear and push the gear forward. Read indicator.
If end play SPECIFICATIONS are exceeded, replace the oil pump assembly.

step1.para:
Loosen and remove the three oil pump mounting bolts and washers ( Figure 8.9
) then remove the oil pump from the crankcase.
Clean R.T.V. sealant from the oil pan and crankcase using a scraper or wire brush. Scrape all gasket material from mating pin.
Clean all parts thoroughly in a suitable solvent, then dry with compressed air.
Visually inspect oil pump gear for chipped or broken teeth. Replace entire oil pump assembly if gear is damaged.
If backlash is not within specifications, replace the oil pump assembly.
Visually inspect the brazed areas of the oil pickup tube, using standard dye penetrant checking methods, to detect cracks. Replace the oil pickup tube if cracks are detected.
Install the oil pump in front of the front bearing cap. Use the three hex-head 5/16 in.-18 x 1-1/2 in. bolts and 5/16 in. hardened washers.

step2.para: Install the 5/16 in. -18 x 1-1/2 in., bolt with hardened washer and the 5/16 in.-18 x 2 in. bolt with hardened washer as shown in Figure 8.10.

note.para: Be sure the 2 in. long bolt is located on top and the 1-1/2in. long bolt is below as shown in Figure 8.10.

step1.para: Install oil pan. Refer to Section 6, " Crankshaft, Main Bearings, Flywheel and Crankcase" for oil pan installation instructions.
